name: Hilton Papagayo Costa Rica Resort & Spa

reviews.title: Very Mediocre
reviews.text: We spent two nights here in early February. We were impressed by only the spa.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms and grounds are in need of a major overhaul. There are maintenance issues everywhere. Areas in need of paint. Sidewalk issues. Housekeeping was subpar in our room with the minibar not stocked routinely and the bath not as clean as one would expect at a Hilton.
reviews.title: Simply the best place to stay, dine and enjoy the Guanacaste area of beautiful Costa Rica!
Beautiful Costa Rica
reviews.text: One big downer is that, short of beer, you have no other alcohol in your room unless you ride a shuttle to one of the bars. For an all inclusive, this was a letdown.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Management needs to step up customer service training......short of one shuttle driver, the others were uninspired.
reviews.title: worst vacation ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was average. Room service was available only with a $15 delivery charge.
reviews.title: Nice, relaxing pace...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We started our January Costa Rica trip here ~ all inclusive ~ came with our son Enzo and his BFF
reviews.title: All Inclusive ~ Great Place ~ Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is a perfect location to do many of the activities area offers, the food was OK not great but a very good value. The boys in their senior yr of college loved it ~ our rooms all had wonderful views of the harbor, we loved the adult area ~ where it was quite and more relaxing, the beach was long but not too inviting lots of shells and nice finds along it. The resorts has buses that fetch you 24/7 since it is so big with lots of area to it ~ great for families, lots to do and enjoy for all, entertainment nightly, friendly staff ~ would recommend for a family trip because it is so cost effective.
reviews.title: Perfect vacation, would go back in a heartbeat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned home from a week-long stay at the Hilton Papagayo resort with my boyfriend, and we loved every minute. The staff were always friendly, prompt, and helpful from check-in to check-out, particularly those working at the activities/concierge desk who even helped us obtain a new camera when ours broke. The room was super clean, the products were always replenished, and the air conditioning was reliable. There was even a nice new flatscreen TV with plenty of english channels.
reviews.title: More like a Bad Best Western

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area was awesome, it's a three-level infinity pool complex which is picturesque and surprisingly spacious (we never had trouble finding lounge chairs). They also keep it incredibly clean; in the afternoon when the wind picked up, staff would be on hand to immediately remove any leaves or debris that blew into the pool.
reviews.title: Very Dissappointing stay at the Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those who love beaches specifically, the beach may be the only slight downfall. It's not white sand and expansive like you might experience at resorts in Cuba or the Dominican, and there aren't chairs directly on the beach (although some people bring them down and look quite comfortable). However, it's clean and the sand is soft and safe to walk in barefoot. You can definitely still swim out in the ocean, and get some great beach pictures, especially when the sun sets. Also, we were told that there's a larger more populated beach about 15 minutes away in Playa Coco, which is a short shuttle ride from the hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointing.
Heaven
reviews.text: I stayed here with my family back in July/August of 2006, which was the rainy season, of course. The hotel was wonderful. The layout was wonderful, with things spread out.. I guess I can see where people would get upset about that, but I think it made it seem more secluded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: and private. I cannot remember the exact room we stayed in, but we were closer to the adults only pool, along with the spa, than we were
reviews.title: False Advertising

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: to the every age pool, with swim-up bar.
reviews.title: Great Vacation at the Fiesta Premier

likes.disliked: — Upon registration, they insisted on having us sign a slip with our credit card, This was scary since they could easily have charged us anything. It turned out find at the end, they give you back the slip for you to tear up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: I was 18 at the time, and found that there was always something to do. The wildlife was beautiful, the things to go out and see were amazing. I find myself wishing I could go down there and just stay put for a year.
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Vacation

likes.disliked: — Long trek to Pool and Facilities from Room, minimal youth activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: When we went for dinner around 7 pm every night, the walkway down to the resturaunts was always empty. it seemed as if everyone hid away in their hotel room at 6pm sharp! Finally, when entering the resturaunt, you'd realize that there really is some life there. hah. The pool was large enough for everyone, and the hotel was near booked. I got the massage by the beach, and that was the most relaxing thing ever.
reviews.title: Four Four Four Por Favor.....Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hilton papagayo was fabulous! The country as a whole was wonderful! I found a review from a traveler who recommended Herson Segura as a travel guide and he was simply amazing! He picked us up at the airport, he had a sign with our name on it grabbed our bags and off we went! He only charges $40.00 versus $55 and trying to find a taxi who may not speak such great English as Herson. His tours are private and fabulous! He took us to places only the locals know of and you are alone not with tons of other people, so you can choose how long you want to stay at each site! The horseback riding and jungle tour at hornillas was simply a once in a lifetime opportunity! Mud bath sauna hot springs in a crater with tons of wildlife! We even saw a white faced monkey above us on the way back from the jungle, which was a private tour with a great kid who spoke great English! Herson took us to Coco Beach to shop for less than a taxi ride and we choose how long we canted to stay and shop, try Coconutz bar and the British bar down the street, great times. If you go, make your excursions prior to getting there or the first day, but take the first few days to relax at the resort. Rooms 101-109 are the first row on the hill overlooking the beach. Then they go 116-134 next row up hill. The 400 rooms are way up the hill but I was told not to take the ones in the hotel part due to lack of air conditioning and not updated. Our room was 118 great for wildlife and view and close to everything, only complaint is double beds and they would not move us to a king bungalow (hilton honor points vs. 375.00 nt income I suppose). So specify king bungalow in 100's close to everything! Very hilly property so bring walking shoes or take shuttles they have. Beaches are volcanic sand and be aware of small crabs and blow fish at night so you don't step on them. I recommend this to everyone! Wish I would have been there for 2 weeks so I could have gone on more tours with Herson! herson03@yahoo.com..... He rocks oh by the way this property is across the bay from the ever so beautiful and expensive Four Seasons at 700-10,000 a night so choose wisely!
reviews.title: Pura Vida at Hilton Papagayo!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is well past its prime, with a number of rundown, outdated physical facilities. It looks poorly maintained - roofs, railings, beach area. The pool, however, is very nice. No hot tub.
reviews.title: Old, run down, not a good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The inside of the room was nice, but no bathtub. The porch was run down with aging railing and floor tiles.
reviews.title: Overall okay but probably would not stay there again and would not highly recommend it to our friends.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fitness club is at the far end of the large complex - very nice, but hard to get to. It is part of what looks like a very expensive spa.
reviews.title: very nice, but not 5 star
Very good trip
reviews.text: The food ranged from very good to terrible - stay away from the pool side restaurant. Drinks are very small and nothing better than Johnnie Walker Red - stick with the mixed drinks, which are good. The wine is barely drinkable. Room service is $15 extra.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from one week AI to premier fiesta; what a perfect choice!! didn't want another typical AI resort and this was the place for sure. it's difficult to know where to begin. the staff is friendly and accomodating; the wines are chilean and quite good; the food is delicious and varied; the a la carte restaurants are delicious as well; the setting is breathtaking...especially in the evenings! we were in the 400 section with morning sun and afternoon shade. our companions had the sunset and a spectacular view of the resort. the Ticos are.....to say friendly, is inadequate. they are like family! guanacaste is very dry this time of year but it is also very beautiful in a raw and unspoiled way. we travelled to a plantation in the rainforest at colonial libertad which is a village whose inhabitants work at the plantation. i won't waste this space with details except to say that the swiss travel guides were xtremely knowledgable and professional and all our drivers were very, very good. a special thanx to marcos of transferbrian who overheard our conversation about a birthday and stopped at coco beach so that we could watch the sunset. The hilton chain has purchased this resort so i would suspect that it will lose it's charm uniqueness and that's kinda sad. our group is tired of cookie-cutter resorts so the next time we will try to find another hidden gem like the premier. i hope you all discover costa rica as we did; a marvellous, beautiful friendly home away from home.
reviews.title: totally awesome costa rica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I and two children have just returned after the March break.
reviews.title: Nice place,Nice people,average rooms

likes.liked: — It was close to all the amenities for my wife and two children.
likes.disliked: — It neede some upgrading...a little paint other than white and a little caulking would have made all the difference!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The resort was very good and the people very friendly.
reviews.title: Fiesta was Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food was typically Costa Rican which was fine even for my two children(4 and 6).
reviews.title: Awesome Vacation!

likes.liked: — Towel art, tiolet paper art, and cleanliness
likes.disliked: — Our air conditioner stopped working on our last night at the resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The weather was very hot and the scenery and gardens were excellent.
reviews.title: Great For Spring Break

likes.disliked: — Poor service in general. Buffet food of little variety and quality.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here with my wife and 3-year old for 4 nights. In short we were pleased but it is nothing special. If I were to book another all-inclusive in this area I would select another hotel next time.
reviews.title: Could do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM: The resort is spread out over a very large area. If you get a room at the further end, there will be a 10 minute walk to the pool/restaurant area or you have to go with the frequent shuttle. Luckily we got a room very close to the pool area. Don't get too close though as there will be a lot of noise in the evening. The room itself was pretty simple a quite worn, but well cleaned. There was a minibar with 2 beers and 4 soft drinks, this was refilled daily.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon Stay w/Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: STAFF/SERVICE: All of the staff were friendly and helpful. They were very happy to help us with special requests due to our daughter. Especially Yoselin in the kids club was super. The only real negative experience was upon check-in when I asked to pay for an upgrade, (I'm a Diamond-member with Hhonors) I was told I would only get my complimentary upgrade but was denied to pay for anything better. Apart from the upgrade, there were no Diamond-benefits really.
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD/BEVERAGE: This was the big letdown of the resort. Food was pretty bland and disappointing, especially at the speciality restaurants. We found the main restaurant food to be the best. However we soon got tired of the same offerings, the desserts were basically all variations of the same whipped cream with chocolate, berries, etc. There were no brand name drinks and the drinks orederd were at times very badly mixed. Wine at the restaurant was always only just white or red from a container. I had expected more from a Hilton property.
reviews.title: quiet enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: POOLS: We never visited the adults-only pool but stayed at the main pool area. This is divided in 3 levels and found them to be very nice, especially with the pool bar. The kids pool however was full of dirt, glasses and drink contains on the first day we arrived. It was only when we complained about this that it was cleaned, it was then kept clean.
reviews.title: Constant Power Outages, Subpar Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I went to Costa Rica for the March 5, 2007 wedding of my sister and her now husband. My mother and I traveled together from Birmingham, AL to Liberia with no problem. The transportation we had arranged (with Swiss Travel) was there to meet up and we checked in with no problem. It was a very pretty resort and had a rustic feel because of all the hills and little bungalows. The shuttles were all over the place to take you to and from places if you didn't want to walk. We were staying near the spa and spa pool which was a great location. We had a great view of the pool and the beach (we were in room 393). My sister and her fiancee's room was higher up (390) and had a wonderful view. The rooms were nice and clean and the staff was very helpful. Marcela, the wedding planning, was especially helpful. We at most breakfasts and dinners at the main dining area by the big pool and there was a good selection. The spa area had great smoothies as well. We had dinner (it was Italian) at the restaurant at the spa and it was great. The day of the wedding my sister, mom and the Fiancee's mom had manicures and pedicures outside by the spa. It was really cool and I think it helped my sister relax before the wedding. The wedding was wonderful. It was on the beach right now from the spa at sunset. The staff was great and there was an impromptu audience. The pictures are great because of the setting and decorations. The reception dinner was also wonderful. he was held in the gazebo by the main pool. It was very intimate and the service was great. It was a very nice trip overall and seeing the iguanas and hanging out on the hammocks was relaxing. I would also recommend the Palo Verde river tour where you can see tons of crocodile, birds and possibly some monkeys. Also try and go shopping down at CoCo Beach. You can arrange a driver with the front desk. There are some better deals (price wise) down there and monkeys in the trees above your head! Because we went during dry season, it didn't rain at all while we were there (Saturday - Wednesday) and we didn't have any trouble with mosquitos or anything, but I would still take some off just in case as welll as sun screen as it gets very hot. Hope you enjoy the trip!
reviews.title: Wonderful Wedding at Fiest Premier

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Fiesta April 15 thru April 21. We had a wonderful time, the resort was nice, the country beautiful and our tour group was great. There were a few snags but nothing that ruined the vacation.
reviews.title: Great Time, Great Value

likes.liked: — Theme night dinners, setting of the countryside

reviews.title: Lots of fun - lost teddy bear
reviews.text: CHECK IN: This was a very quick and easy process, the front desk lady was nice and spoke wonderful English. We were given rum punch while we checked in. We did arrive around 12:30 and check in is not until 3 but they had our room ready and we had a shuttle that took us to our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: ROOM: This is very basic. However, we did not go on vacation to sit in our room so this was not a big deal. It has a king size bed, tv, shower, bathroom, sink, mirror and fridge... do not really need much else. We were in room 128 so the hill was not terrible, I do see where people might not like the walk to some of the rooms higher up. Even being one of the lower rooms I was convinced my back side was going to be toned by the end of the trip. Our A/C was leaking and we told the front desk right away. About 2 days later it was fixed. Once this was done it was great, but prior to it getting fixed it was loud and ran continuously, our room was a bit warm. It was not worth ruining the vacation, the temp was still tolerable and the problem was taken care of. We were nervous at first with maid service because we did not see her for 2 days. When she did come we tipped her $2 and saw her everyday after that and she did a wonderful job.
reviews.title: Nice all-inclusvie
Premiere Fiesta was Great for the Money!
reviews.text: POOL: The pool was ok, a little dirty but not worth getting upset about. The size seemed small but I never felt that it was over crowded. The pool bartender Gab was outstanding (make sure you take care of him). He was one of the hardest working people at the resort. However, they need to get him some help because he was his own barback. If he ran out of glasses he had to leave his post to find glasses then come back and wash them, if he needed ice, he had to run to get it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Fiesta from Feb 9th thru to the 23rd 2007 and loved every minute of it. The resort is on a fantastic piece of land over looking the Bay with a beautiful beach. The resort itself was very very clean. We saw the bartender at the spa bar cleaning the beer tap with a toothbrush! Now that's clean! Our rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. We were in adjoining bungalows and had no problems with the air conditioning or bathroom facilities. The bathrooms in our bungalows were very clean but could use some upgrading. I'm a picky eater and I had no problem finding something to eat. We found the food very nice with an excellent selection. I also took advantage of the spa facilities while there and had a four hand message on the beach in the cabanna as well as a volcano body wrap and the service was excellent and the spa facilities were again very clean and comfortable. The staff at the Fiesta is the cream of the crop. We don't speak Spanish but had absolutely no problem communicating as most of the staff can speak English. All of them were very friendly and accommodating. The "Fun Patrol" as I called them are a talented group of young people who you will see are consistenly on the move making sure everyone is having fun, from early in the morning handing out beach towels to the afternoon dance lesson by the pool (lots of laughs) and then finally putting on an eveing show (1 hr) with great costumes and great dancing. The bartenders are quick with a smile and provided great service and even took the time to teach us a little bit of Spanish. We are planning to go back in 2008 . A note to the new owners of the Fiesta please don't fix what's not broken it's perfect just the way it is!
reviews.title: Perfect the Way it is!

likes.disliked: — Although spotless the tub and showers could be upgraded they are a bit worn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Fox's, Okotoks, Alberta, Canada
reviews.title: A grand experience on the Papagayo Gulf

likes.liked: — Pool area, overall food, options for tours/activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have spent several months reading the reviews of other travelers for the Fiesta Premier in preparation for our trip. I cannot find any justification to give this resort any less than a four out of five, as long as you know that the Resort is not a Sandals, nor it is intended to be. While the Fiesta Premier is not without its minor problems (very minor from our experience), it provides the perfect location for a relaxing and fulfilling getaway. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Excellent trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fiesta from February 24th - March 1st, 2007. True to the reviews, the resort is very hilly - not for the week kneed - although we saw people of all ages (families, couples, and seniors) enjoying themselves as much as we did. While Fiesta will never rival a Waldorf or a Ritz-Carlton, the rooms are clean, the bathrooms well apportioned, Cable TV is piped in for those who cannot get away from the Oscars or CNN, and wireless internet exists all around the beachfront and pool area.
reviews.title: Faboulos nature-warm people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food can be hit or miss - but I would never characterize it as bad. The snack bar can be counted on for reliably good snack food (chips and guacamole, sandwiches), El Dorado can be counted on for a very good meal overall, with a few rough spots (things can be overcooked, but just advise the wait staff how you would like it), and the dinner buffet always had a few outstanding dishes (arroz con pollo, plantains, salads, meats on BBQ night). Each night is a different theme at the Fiesta buffet (Spanish, Italian, BBQ, Costa Rica). Drinks were generally outstanding, especially the fruit smoothies made at the Spa section of the resort.
reviews.title: Not my best vacation experience ever

description: Nestled in a bay surrounded by the Pacific Ocean at the Gulf of Papagayo in Guanacaste, our resort is the perfect place to let your worries drift away. The magnificent view of the tranquil waters, the surrounding lush tropical gardens and abundant wildlife will make you experience the true Costa Rican feel.This magical all-inclusive resort also offers:- Convenient location, only 20 minutes from the Liberia International Airport- Large property but with an intimate atmosphere and feel- New all inclusive concept with boutique-style service without the need of bracelets or towel cards and no limit in à la carte dining. - Private beach feel with calm tides year round- Casita-style bungalows perched hillside overlooking the bay. - World-class Spa offering full range of traditional and exotic treatments in a Costa Rican – inspired natural ambiance- Unforgettable setting for Honeymoons and Weddings - Venues which add a local flair to your meetings, incentives and other social gatherings.- Just minutes away from major local attractions, National Parks and beaches
